EmailTemplate.subject: 5 reasons property developers are choosing Passive Optical LAN
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
${preheader} View as web page <[[{{system.viewAsWebpageLink}}]]> Ethernet-over-copper LANs are on their way out. Time for Passive Optical LAN Architects, construction companies and real estate developers around the world are changing in-building connectivity. Old Ethernet-over-copper LANs are on their way out. New Passive Optical LAN technology is on its way in.
Passive Optical LAN solution uses fiber technology – the same that powers the internet – to deliver a host of benefits.
- Cost. Passive Optical LAN is up to 50% cheaper to install and operate than a traditional copper-based network.
- Performance. Passive Optical LAN delivers up to 1 Gb/s to every occupant in your smart building and has potentially unlimited scalability. - Longevity. Fiber optic cabling has a 50+ year lifespan. Install once and never touch it again.
- Energy. Passive Optical LAN consumes significantly less energy and helps meet building codes and environmental regulations.
- Space. Less equipment means valuable floorspace is no longer sacrificed for equipment rooms and closets.
